item.title: Fortnite is coming to the Xbox PC store
item.description: Fortnite is going to be available on the Xbox on PC app beginning November 18th. Right now on PC, you have to launch the game from the Epic Games Launcher, but if you prefer the Xbox on PC app, that’s going to be an option. The game is also joining the Xbox Play Anywhere program, […]

item.title: Hacked company CTO refuses to pay ransom demand, donates money to funding research instead
item.description: Following a breach of an improperly decommissioned cloud drive, Checkout.com refuses to pay ransom.

Dans ce contexte dynamique, Thales Alenia Space s'engage dans le développement de la station cislunaire Gateway,...

item.title: Supergreens powder and supplements recalled nationwide after Salmonella outbreak sickens people in 7 states

The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is investigating a multistate outbreak of Salmonella infections linked to powdered dietary supplements. According to the latest update from the agency, the outbreak has sickened almost a dozen people, with three hospitalized....

item.title: The latest opioid settlement plan with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma could end the yearslong legal saga
item.description: Only 218 out of more than 54,000 personal injury victims rejected Purdue’s latest bankruptcy plan. Lawyers representing OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma, branches of the Sackler family that own it, cities, states, counties, Native American tribes, people with addiction and others across the U.S. are expected to deliver a nearly unanimous message for a bankruptcy court judge Friday: Approve a plan to settle thousands of opioid-related lawsuits against the company.If U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Sean Lane abides, it will close a long chapter — and maybe the entire book — on a legal odyssey over efforts to...

item.title: On a testé la Wallbox Pulsar Pro : la borne (presque) parfaite ? Complète, mais encore perfectible
item.description: La marque Wallbox est une des références dans le domaine des bornes de recharge et la Pulsar Pro s'impose comme l'un des modèles les plus avancés du marché. Elle dispose notamment d'une des connectivités les plus avancées, mais également d'un câble attaché avec obturateur, devenu obligatoire en France. Voyons ce qu'elle vaut en utilisation quotidienne et comment elle se démarque de la concurrence. ...

item.title: Trump tried to brand a Democratic shutdown. It didn’t work
item.description: A government shutdown is always a blame game. Now that it’s over, it’s time to ask: Who played the better match? President Donald Trump has worked to blame Democrats for the government shutdown, but a majority of Americans are unconvinced that it’s Democrats’ fault.

item.title: Anthropic reports AI-driven cyberattack linked to China
item.description: The operation targeted about 30 individuals who worked at tech companies, financial institutions, chemical companies, and government agencies. A team of researchers has uncovered what they say is the first reported use of artificial intelligence to direct a hacking campaign in a largely automated fashion.

item.title: Five people plead guilty to helping North Koreans infiltrate US companies as ‘remote IT workers’
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice said five people — including four U.S. nationals — "facilitated" North Korean IT workers to get jobs at American companies, allowing the regime to earn money from their remote labor.

item.title: ‘Dispatch’ Is Better at Superheroic Redemption Than Romance
item.description: I came to save the day, 'Dispatch,' not be forced into one of two pairings I'm not sure I even want or deserve.

item.title: Inside the Multimillion-Dollar Plan to Make Mobile Voting Happen
item.description: Political consultant Bradley Tusk has spent a fortune on mobile voting efforts. Now, he’s launching a protocol to try to mainstream the technology.

item.title: We’ve got to teach AI the right way. And there’s no time to waste
item.description: We’ve got to learn from past mistakes in our education system. Americans have done a shoddy job of teaching reading and math to the majority of our students. Our scores, when compared to other nations—most with fewer resources—are plummeting.

item.title: From cognitive decline to burnout: AI’s overlooked impact on workers
item.description: Despite AI having many advantages, it also comes with side effects we need to consider when integrating it at work. AI was supposed to make our lives easier: automating tedious tasks, streamlining communication, and freeing up time for creative thinking. But what if the very tool meant to increase efficiency is fueling cognitive decline and burnout instead?...

item.title: Baseball United hosts first game in Dubai with its own rules
item.description: The league has created some of its own novel rules to speed up games and put more runs on the board—and potentially draw in U.S. fans. Emerging like a mirage in the desert outskirts of Dubai, a sight unfamiliar to those in the Middle East and Asia has risen up like a dream in the exact dimensions of the field at Yankee Stadium in New York.

item.title: For a limited time, get your first three months of Audible for $0.99 per month — plus enjoy a $20 Audible credit
item.description: Audible for $.99 for three months
